Record date: 2066-03-05
INTERNAL MEDICINE ASSOCIATES
OCHILTREE GENERAL HOSPITAL
History of present illness The patient is a 53year-old male returns for diabetes and evaluation of swelling in his right testicle. He was seen on 02/20/2066, given Levaquin for orchitis versus epididymis. The patient took the medicine and was seen by Urology. By the time, he saw Urology on 03/04/2066, the swelling had mostly resolved. The patient has no pain nor urinary symptoms. Urine culture was negative. He feels fine at this time. No polyuria or polydipsia. No chest pain or shortness of breath.
Major Problems
Impotence
Degenerative arthritis
Hyperlipidemia
Diabetes mellitus (adult onset)
Change in therapies and Renewals
Viagra PRN
Avandia 4 mg 1 tab qd
Naprosyn 500 mg bid PRN
Pravachol 20 mg QD
aspirin 325 mg 1 tab qd
Levaquin 500 mg po qd x10d QTY:10 Refills:0 Start: 2/20/2066 End: 3/05/2066 - Inactivated
Physical examination
Blood pressure 138/90
Weight 209 pounds
General appearance No acute distress
Chest Lungs clear
Cor Regular rhythm. S1 and S2 normal. No murmur, S3, or S4
Abdomen Soft and nontender. No masses
Genitalia Testicles, normal sized bilaterally. No pain or no swelling. No hernia
Extrem No edema
Assessment and plan Epididymis. Resolved. Return if symptoms recur Type 2 diabetes mellitus. Check hemoglobin A1c. Continue Avandia Hyperlipidemia. Continue Pravachol
Disposition
Return in three months.

INTERNAL MEDICINE ASSOCIATES
OCHILTREE GENERAL HOSPITAL
Reason for visit URI
History of present illness Pt has URI with cough for several weeks. The majority of this 25 minute visit was spent in counseling about hid drinking.
Major Problems
Diabetes mellitus (adult onset)
No sx. HB A1c was good last month.
Hyperlipidemia
has started lipitor without problem about a month ago. Not fasting today.
Other Problems
Cough
Pt had uri about a month ago. He has continued to have disturbing cough after acute symptoms resolved. He describes cough worse in cold air, starting after he gets into the weather. No scarf. No history of asthma. No supine sx. Exam neg. Offered alupent inhaler and instructed to use muffler for probable dx of cold induced asthma.
Depression
Subject came up re asking about drinking (potential relation to cough). He drank heavily after Korea (field nurse) and had depression at that time. He had SI about 18 months ago. Now seeing Navarro (rx) and Lacey Frost (Tx) ans is on two drugs paxil and another. States they reliably cause him to vomit if he drinks. States drinks two rums and diet coke a night. Thinks he should stop; discussed; needs to bring this up with his tx. Not si now, states mood stable.
Change in therapies and Renewals
Proventil two puffs inhaled qid QTY:1 cannister Refills:3 Start: 01/28/2067 prn
Habits
Alcohol use status: major

Neck No masses
Chest Lungs are clear
Cor Regular rhythm. S1 and S2 normal. No murmur, S3, or S4
temperature 98.0

return in two months; obtain fasting lipids before then.

**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2067-03-06
INTERNAL MEDICINE ASSOCIATES
OCHILTREE GENERAL HOSPITAL
History of present illness This is a 54-year-old white male here complaining persistent cough. He has had a dry cough for about two months. He was put on inhalers, but there was no improvement. The cough is worse at night, but also he has it during the day. He has no mucus production, no hemoptysis, no shortness of breath, and no wheezing. He is a nonsmoker. About a week ago, he was admitted to a local emergency room for chest pain. He was rushed to Ochiltree General because of ST-T wave abnormalities on his EKG. In retrospect, he has had these changes for many years, and anyway he had a cardiac catheterization, which showed mild obstruction of some of his coronary systems but no evidence of coronary artery syndrome. He did have cardiomyopathy with the ejection fraction of 35%. He was sent home on Toprol XL 50 mg QD, Lipitor 10 mg QD, lisinopril 10 mg, aspirin 325 mg once a day, and Avandia 2 mg once a day. Since returning home, the patient feels no chest pain or shortness of breath. No orthopnea or PND. He still has a dry cough.
Change in therapies and Renewals
Viagra 50mg PRN QTY:15 Refills:3 Start: 10/05/2063
Avandia 2 mg 1 tab qd QTY:30 Refills:3 Start: 1/31/2065
aspirin 325 mg 1 tab qd QTY:30 Refills:1 yr Start: 3/12/2065
lisinopril 10 mg QD Start: 8/4/2066
Lipitor 10mg po qd Start: 12/17/2066
Proventil two puffs inhaled qid QTY:1 cannister Refills:3 Start: 1/28/2067 End: 3/06/2067 prn - Inactivated
Toprol XL 50 mg po qd Start: 03/06/2067
Prilosec 20mg po bid QTY:60 Refills:1 Start: 03/06/2067 take before meals
Physical examination
Blood pressure 110/80
Weight 214 pounds
General appearance Well-developed and well-nourished, no acute distress
Skin Clear
Heent Eyes, nonicteric. Nose clear. Pharynx normal
Neck No masses. Neck veins not distended
Chest Lungs clear
Cor Regular rhythm. S1 and S2 normal. No murmur, S3, or S4
Abdomen Soft, nontender, and no masses. No liver or spleen palpable
Extrem No edema
Assessment and plan Cardiomyopathy. Continue present medications. Complete abstention from alcohol advised.
Diabetes. Check hemoglobin A1c.
Persistent cough. Question GERD. Plan: A trial of Prilosec 20 mg twice a day. Schedule upper GI. Return in one month. If cough persists, consider a role of lisinopril. However, he was taking lisinopril long before his cough started.
Hyperlipidemia. Continue Lipitor. Check lipid profile.
Impotence. Refill Viagra.

CARDIOLOGY
OCHILTREE GENERAL HOSPITAL
Reason for visit:
Follow-up appointment for cardiomyopathy
Interval History:
Mr Lara reports no problems since the time of his last visit. He insistists that he has absolutely abstained from etoh since his last visit.
Denies fevers, chills. denies palpitations or syncope.
Under a fair amount of stress at home: his son is home after a head injury and neurological complications of an MVA and is fairly debilitated. He has had to give up his job to help take care of him.
Past medical history:
diabetes, cad, cardiomyopathy
Medications (Confirmed):
aspirin 325 mg 1 tab qd
Avandia 2 mg 1 tab qd
Levitra 10mg po qd PRN
Lipitor
lisinopril 10 mg QD
Patanol 0.1% eye drops
Prilosec 20mg po bid
Synalar ointment .025%
Toprol XL

see above. remainder negative in detail
Physical examination:
-BP: 160/90
-Pulse: 73 bpm
-General: No acute distress.
-Heent: Unremarkable
-Chest: Clear to auscultation and percussion.
-Cardiac: Left ventricular impulse discrete and nondisplaced. Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 and S2. There were no clicks or rubs. ? faint 1/6 systolic murmur at the apex.
-weight: 205
-BMI:
-Abdomen: normal active bowel sounds.
-Extremities: without clubbing or edema.
-Neuro: A+Ox3
EKG:
Sinus Rhythm with 2 pvcs. Q waves leads 1, AVL RPO high lateral infarction. Apical TWI. Q waves leads V5 and v6 rpo oapical MI. C 8/67, TWI more marked.
Assessment and plan:
55 yom with history of cardiomyopathy likely secondary to etoh use; at time of cath, he had mild-moderate CAD found. Also, hypetension
1) Patient missed his last echo appt. Will reschedule to check for interval improvement on treatment and off moonshine. Pt counseled to give up all etoh for ~ 6mos at least. He voices understanidng.
2) hypertension: not acceptable at this level given diabetes. I have asked Joe to increase his lisinopril to 40 mg
3) diabetes: well controlled by Dr. Thomson
4) CAD: on a statin (DM is CAD equiv as well)
Cardiac prescriptions written

**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2069-10-10
CARDIOLOGY
OCHILTREE GENERAL HOSPITAL
Reason for visit: The patient is a 61 yo Equadorian male admitted for cardiac cath after an episode of chest pain with? positive markers.
Interval History: The patient was transferred to OGH in 3/2067 because of chest pain with positive markers and aaaanterolateral T wave changes.At which time he was diagnosed with possible ETOH myocarditis. His EF was 34%. He underwent cardiac cath which showed that the Left Main and LAD were patent, , a very distal LCX lesion. RCA was dominant and patent. The patient was discharged to home on a program of ace, BB, ASA and instructed to curtail his ETOH use. His EF improved to 66 %. He had repeat nuclear stress testing which showed small anterior infarct/small prior inferior infarct and was negative for ischemia in July 2068.. Since then he has had a stable angina pattern with chest pain brought on when he has to move very heavy objects in his work as a packager . This is usually relieved with one TNG. Most recently, he was seen by his PC Dr. Thomson and treated with Augmentin/Robitussin AC for a URI. He had a productive cough and some chest discomfort related to coughing. Most recently, he was brought into police custody for public intoxication. While in his jail cell,"resting" he developed the sudden onset on midsternal sharp chest pain accompanied by heavy breathing. There was no radiation to the arms, but he noted bilateral hand numbness. He also had palpitations and sweating and felt nauseated. He received one sl TNG. An ambulance was called and he received 2 TNG sprays. His pain diminished. His BP was 176/100 at the time. He was brought to the Evanston Hospital ER and found to have "high lateral changes" on his EKG's. Troponins were slightly elevated at .13- considered a "gray zone" for the hospitals range for MI. The patient was pain free after a dose of Morphine. While in the hospital, he was placed on suicide watch. He has a history of a suicide attempt 3 years ago and has previously had counseling and been on antidepressants. He has a son who is in a vegetative state after an MVA whom he helps care for and this is very stressful. His recent arrest made hiite despondent. At Evanston Hospital, he was started on a beta blocker and Lovenox. He had a suboptimal stress test which was stopped because of SSCP and nausea. He is now transferred to OGH for further evaluation.
Past medical history: diabetes Cardiomyopathy(?ETOH related) CAD- 50 % LCX lesion 3/67 Depression with suicide attempt 3 years ago- was on antidepressants until 6 months ago Obesity
Changes to Allergies
No known allergies No known drug allergy
Medications (Confirmed):
aspirin 325 mg daily Augmentin 500mg/125mg po q8h x 10 days Levitra 20mg po daily PRN Lipitor 10 mg daily lisinopril 40 mg daily metformin hydrochloride 500 mg daily Patanol 0.1% eye drops Prilosec 20 mg daily Robitussin ac 100mg/10mg/5ml po q4-6h PRN cough Synalar ointment 0.025% Voltaren 75 mg BID PRN
Family history: non contributory
Social history: working until recently- was "packaging manager for Johnson & Johnson" no smoking rare etoh- one glass red wine with evening meal Lives with wife/2 daughters- has son in vegetative state after car accident whom family cares for
Review of systems: see above. remainder negative in detail
Physical examination:
-BMI: 42.6 Obese, high risk -Pulse: 62 bpm -weight: 225 lbs. -Neck: jvp 6 cm without bruits -Chest: Clear to auscultation and percussion. -Cardiac: Left ventricular impulse discrete and nondisplaced. Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 and S2. Split S2 There were no clicks or rubs. -Abdomen: normal active bowel sounds.No HSM -Extremities: without clubbing or edema.- Femoral pulse 2+ DP @+ -BP: 126/87
EKG: NSB 60 Q 1, L, TWI L, V5-6, c/w 10/14 ECG
Selected recent labs:
to be drawn upon admission
Other Data: Cath: 3/67: patent LM/LAD, LCX 50% stenosis, RCA dominant Last echo 12 /67 EF 63% walls 12/8 mild MR, symmetrical LVH, trace PI, RVSP 41 borderline RVH Nuclear cardiology 7/68: small prior ant infarct/inf. infarct- no ischemia, EF nl
Assessment and plan: The patient is a 47 yo diabetic, with known CAD, improved EF after d/c of ETOH now admitted after episode of chest pain with ? EKG changes and "intermediate"Troponins per local hospital assay.Case reviewed with Dr. Levine. Would continue ASA, beta Blocker and Lisinopril in addition to usual meds. He has previous CAD and is diabetic. Even though stess test was suboptimal, he has risk factors of diabetes, obesity and hypertension, and 50 % LCX lesion , so would proceed with cath tomorrow. NPO after midnight for cath lab. He is currently pain free so no heparin for now. Would check serial EKG;s, and troponins in addition to usual labs. Please obtain fasting cholesterol panel.
Will need psychiatric consult to aseess suicidality though he currently denies this.
Agree hold NSAIDs/Voltaren intil after cath.
Florene Kim, NP
